awd_titl_txt: U.S.-China Collaborative Research: Investigation of Inter-  faces in Low Temperature Oxygen Sensors Based on Rare-Earth Fluorides
awd_abstract_narration: 9604950  Fergus    This award supports initiation of collaborative research in  materials science between Jeffrey Fergus, Auburn University,  and Wang Yinbang, Beijing University of Science and  Technology.  The research involves evaluation of the  potential of several lanthanide fluorides in thin-film low-  temperature oxygen sensors.  Oxygen sensors are used in  industrial processing and control applications; improved  understanding of the mechanisms of lanthanum fluoride  sensors will be of significant value to the electrochemical  community.    The project will make use of complementary facilities and  expertise at the two universities.  Auburn University will  provide expertise in development and testing of chemical  sensors, and will perform the electrochemical  characterization of the sensor performance.  Beijing  University of Science and Technology will provide the thin-  film fabrication and surface characterization expertise.
org_div_long_name: Office of International Science and Engineering
